title: The new rename tracking feature is slow
body:
I have tested the current master with the `--track-ranames` flag set on one of my photo disks, 21 GB of fairly large RAW files, renamed 5 of them and then sync to another USB3 disk.

My implementation (https://github.com/bep/rclone/tree/renames):

```
Transferred:      0 Bytes (0 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:               346
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:       10.5s
11.32s  user 2.34s system 88% cpu 15.432 total
avg shared (code):         0 KB
avg unshared (data/stack): 0 KB
total (sum):               0 KB
max memory:                175496 MB
page faults from disk:     3630
other page faults:         365136
````

Current master:

```
Transferred:   6.004 kBytes (15 Bytes/s)
Errors:                 0
Checks:               704
Transferred:            1
Elapsed time:     6m29.5s
110.73s  user 16.39s system 31% cpu 6:39.87 total
avg shared (code):         0 KB
avg unshared (data/stack): 0 KB
total (sum):               0 KB
max memory:                173104 MB
page faults from disk:     4112
other page faults:         696919
```

From the log it looks like it performs hashing of every file, which sounds very sub-optimal in all the common use cases I can think of.

I have repeated the test twice with similar results.

I will continue to use my own fork for the time being, but I thought I would give a heads up.
